string.text:
%c[pda_white]Available main menu keybinds on debug mode:
 
 %c[d_orange]LOADED GAME ONLY:
 %c[pda_blue]• %c[pda_white]F7:%c[ui_gray_2] Start Anomaly Debugger
 %c[pda_blue]• %c[pda_white]1:%c[ui_gray_2] Debug HUD - Switch Left Panel Info Feedback
 %c[pda_blue]• %c[pda_white]2:%c[ui_gray_2] Debug HUD - Switch Middle Panel Info Feedback
 %c[pda_blue]• %c[pda_white]3:%c[ui_gray_2] Debug HUD - Switch Right Panel Info Feedback
 
 %c[d_orange]WITHOUT LOADED GAME:
 %c[pda_blue]• %c[pda_white]F2:%c[ui_gray_2] Launch Test Map
 
 %c[d_orange]BOTH CASES:
 %c[pda_blue]• %c[pda_white]Numpad 0:%c[ui_gray_2] Reload system_ini()

%c[pda_white]Anomaly Weather Editor 2.0
 
 %c[pda_green]Information:
 The Weather editor allows the changing of weather values in real-time.
 The GUI is interactive and easy to use, with the ability to modify or create weather files on the fly.
 Modified values are temporarily cached for the weathers and hours that were worked on.
 These may be returned to in case the editor was turned off (Avoid exiting or reloading when with unsaved values).
 In (Viewer) mode, weather changes may be seen in real-time via the time slider.
 
 %c[pda_blue]Keybinds:
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]ARROW KEYS: %c[ui_gray_2]Parameter Navigation
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]LSHIFT (Hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x10 Value Step / Jump 2 Parameters
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]LALT (Hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x50 Value Step / Jump 3 Parameters
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]R/F: %c[ui_gray_2]Increase/Reduce Selected Value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]T/G: %c[ui_gray_2]Increase/Reduce All Selected Values
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]Q/A: %c[ui_gray_2]Select Next/Previous Hour
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]W/S: %c[ui_gray_2]Select Next/Previous Minute
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]E/D: %c[ui_gray_2]Select Next/Previous Saved Moment
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]Z: %c[ui_gray_2]Start Viewer Mode
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]C: %c[ui_gray_2]Copy Select Parameter Value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]C + CTRL: %c[ui_gray_2]Copy Current Settings
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]V: %c[ui_gray_2]Paste/Apply Copied Parameter Value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]V + CTRL: %c[ui_gray_2]Paste/Apply Current Settings
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]DELETE: %c[ui_gray_2]Reset Current Modified Moment
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]DELETE + CTRL: %c[ui_gray_2]Reset All Modified Moments
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]H: %c[ui_gray_2]Toggle Help Window
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]ESC or HOME: %c[ui_gray_2]Turn Off Editor
Save to new file if the name was indicated in the box below, otherwise save to current file.\n Custom file names must start with "w_".
Exit (weather will still pause in engine)
New file (%s) is not valid.\n File name must start with "w_".\n Tip: Empty names will save to the current file.

%c[pda_white]Weapon HUD Editor
 
 %c[pda_green]About:
 The Weapon HUD editor allows alteration of the weapon HUD position and orientation in real-time.
 The GUI is interactive and easy to use, with the ability to save adjusted pos to a temp file "temp_hud.ltx".
 Edited values are temporarily cached for weapons that were worked on.
 These may be returned to in case the editor was turned off (Avoid exiting or reloading when with unsaved values).
 
 %c[pda_red]Attention:
 Weapons configs must be unpacked before working with the editor and must be located in (%c[pda_white]gamedata/configs/items/weapons%c[ui_gray_2]).
 Changes saved to HUD parameters will not take effect until the game is restarted.
 For parameters that affect aiming positioning, first enable 'aim toggle' in options and aim with the weapon, then use the editor to see your changes.
 (%c[pda_white]gamedata/configs/cache_dbg.ltx%c[ui_gray_2]) will keep track of the original parameters upon changing, so they may be reset with the 'Reset' button.
 Do not forget to make a backup of the configs for reference.
 
 %c[pda_blue]Keybinds:
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]ARROW KEYS: %c[ui_gray_2]Parameter Navigation
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]NUMPAD 8/2: %c[ui_gray_2]Increase/Reduce Selected Value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]NUMPAD 9/3: %c[ui_gray_2]Increase/Reduce All Selected Values
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]LSHIFT (Hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x10 Value Step / Jump 2 Parameters
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]LALT (Hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x50 Value Step / Jump 3 Parameters
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]NUMPAD 5: %c[ui_gray_2]Copy Current Stats
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]NUMPAD 6: %c[ui_gray_2]Paste Stored Stats
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]G: %c[ui_gray_2]Toggle Crosshair
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]H: %c[ui_gray_2]Show Help Window
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]ESC: %c[ui_gray_2]Turn Off Editor

%c[pda_white]Item Editor
 
 %c[pda_green]About:
 The Item Editor allows the editing of item configs and the ability to directly save/test changes in-game.
 The GUI is interactive and easy to use, supporting weapons, outfits and artefact editing.
 You may select a relative item in the list to compare its stats to the active item.
 Modified values are temporarily cached for the items that were worked on.
 These may be returned to in case the editor was turned off (Avoid exiting or reloading when with unsaved values).
 
 %c[pda_red]Attention:
 Item configs must be unpacked before working with the editor and must be located in (%c[pda_white]gamedata/configs/items%c[ui_gray_2]).
 (%c[pda_white]gamedata/configs/cache_dbg.ltx%c[ui_gray_2]) will keep track of the original parameters upon changing, so they may be reset with the 'Reset' button.
 Don't forget to make a backup of the configs for reference.
 
 n%c[pda_blue]Keybinds:
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]ARROW KEYS: %c[ui_gray_2]Parameter Navigation
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]NUMPAD 8/2: %c[ui_gray_2]Increase/Reduce Selected Value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]NUMPAD 9/3: %c[ui_gray_2]Increase/Reduce All Selected Values
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]LSHIFT (hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x10 Value Step / Jump 2 Parameters
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]LALT (hold): %c[ui_gray_2]x50 Value Step / Jump 3 Parameters
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]NUMPAD 5: %c[ui_gray_2]Copy Current Stats
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]NUMPAD 6: %c[ui_gray_2]Paste Stored Stats
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]H: %c[ui_gray_2]Show Help Window
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]ESC: %c[ui_gray_2]Turn Off Editor

%c[pda_green]Description:\N %c[ui_gray_2]The amount of damage incurred by the bullet.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range:
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[d_cyan](!)%c[ui_gray_2] This is a statistic parameter.
 
 %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Each value for this parameter is used for a different difficulty:
 Master -> Veteran -> Stalker -> Novice
 Vanilla difficulty is not used in Anomaly. Use the same value for all.

%c[pda_green]Description %c[ui_gray_2]The physical force of a round. Higher values cause more dramatic ragdoll deaths.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description %c[ui_gray_2]The distance in meters before the bullet 'dies' - anything beyond this range will not be hit.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description %c[ui_gray_2]The rate of fire, in rounds per minute.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description %c[ui_gray_2]The rate at which the 'empty' sound file will play, if a weapon is fired while empty.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Depth of field modifier when using iron-sights.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The amount of 'brakes' applied to the gun - how difficult it is to turn quickly and reliably. Notable on the PKm and SVD. Affects the handling statistic.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[d_cyan](!)%c[ui_gray_2] This is a statistic parameter.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The amount of inertia from maneuvering the camera - how likely your aim is to drift off target if you jerk the mouse. Affects the handling statistic.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The basic cone of fire in degrees - how accurate the gun's first burst will be. Affects basic accuracy and the displayed accuracy statistic.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[d_cyan](!)%c[ui_gray_2] This is a statistic parameter.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The probability of a misfire occurring at ANY time (This parameter is not used).
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Weapon condition at which the misfire chance starts to rise - misfires won't happen at a higher condition.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 
 %c[pda_blue]Jamming Chance Calculation:
 %c[pda_white]Misfire Chance Per Shot = start_prop + ( (start_con - condition) x (end_prop - start_prop) / factor ).
 
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]Condition:%c[ui_gray_2] current weapon condition.
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]start_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_prob" value.
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]end_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_prob" value.
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]start_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_condition" value.
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]end_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_condition" value.
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]factor:%c[ui_gray_2] (start_con - end_con) when those values are different, or (start_con) only if they are identical.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Weapon's condition where misfiring chance stops rising. Misfire chance will cap at "misfire_end_prob" on lower condition.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[pda_blue]Jamming Chance Calculation:
 %c[pda_white]Misfire chance on shot = start_prop + ( (start_con - condition) x (end_prop - start_prop) / factor )
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]condition:%c[ui_gray_2] current weapon condition
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]start_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_prob" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]end_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_prob" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]start_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_condition" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]end_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_condition" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]factor:%c[ui_gray_2] (start_con - end_con) when those values are different, or (start_con) only if they are identical.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The starting chance of misfiring.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[pda_blue]Jamming Chance Calculation:
 %c[pda_white]Misfire Chance Per Shot = start_prop + ( (start_con - condition) x (end_prop - start_prop) / factor )
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]condition:%c[ui_gray_2] current weapon condition
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]start_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_prob" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]end_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_prob" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]start_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_condition" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]end_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_condition" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]factor:%c[ui_gray_2] (start_con - end_con) when those values are different, or (start_con) only if they are identical.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The ending chance of misfiring.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[pda_blue]Jamming Chance Calculation:
 %c[pda_white]Misfire Chance Per Shot = start_prop + ( (start_con - condition) x (end_prop - start_prop) / factor )
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]condition:%c[ui_gray_2] current weapon condition
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]start_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_prob" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]end_prop:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_prob" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]start_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_start_condition" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]end_con:%c[ui_gray_2] "misfire_end_condition" value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]factor:%c[ui_gray_2] (start_con - end_con) when those values are different, or (start_con) only if they are identical.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]How much condition is lost per shot.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[pda_blue]Calculation:
 %c[pda_white]Condition Loss Per Shot = (condition_shot_dec) x (weapon_degredation) x (impair) x (condition_shot_dec_k)
 
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]"condition_shot_dec"%c[ui_gray_2] is defined per weapon section. Set "condition_queue_shot_dec" to the same value
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]"weapon_degredation"%c[ui_gray_2] is a console command, allowing in-game control for degradation in general (defaulted to 1)
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]"impair"%c[ui_gray_2] is a parameter defined in the ammo section the weapon is currently using
 
%c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]"condition_shot_dec_k"%c[ui_gray_2] is a parameter defined in the suppressor section attached to the weapon (defaulted to 1 if it's missing)

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]How much condition is lost per shot during full-auto fire.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[pda_blue]Calculation:
 %c[pda_white]Condition Loss Per Shot = (condition_shot_dec) x (weapon_degredation) x (impair) x (condition_shot_dec_k)
 
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]"condition_shot_dec"%c[ui_gray_2] is defined per weapon section. Set "condition_queue_shot_dec" to the same value
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]"weapon_degredation"%c[ui_gray_2] is a console command, allowing in-game control for degradation in general (defaulted to 1)
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]"impair"%c[ui_gray_2] is a parameter defined in the ammo section the weapon is currently using
 %c[d_purple]• %c[pda_white]"condition_shot_dec_k"%c[ui_gray_2] is a parameter defined in the suppressor section attached to the weapon (defaulted to 1 if it's missing)

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Whether or not the camera returns to your target afterwards.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The speed at which the crosshair return to "neutral"
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 (degree)

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Dispersion upon shooting (no aim).
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 (degree) %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]This value is not capped in engine, negative values will caused negative recoil.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]How much is added to dispersion with each shot.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 (degree) %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]This value is not capped in engine, negative values will cause negative recoil.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The maximum angle recoil can carry the crosshair from origin - in this case, 50 degrees up.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Horizontal recoil caused by firing. 0 will cause vertical recoil, negative will recoil to the left.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The speed at which iron sights/scopes return to neutral.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 (degree) %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]If this parameter is not defined in the weapon section, the engine will use "cam_relax_speed" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Dispersion (only affects iron sights/scopes).
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 (degree) %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]If this parameter is not defined in the weapon section, the engine will use "cam_dispersion" value instead.
 This value is not capped in engine - negative values will cause negative recoil.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]How much is added to dispersion with each shot (only affects iron sights/scopes).
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range (degree)
 %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]If this parameter is not defined in the weapon section, the engine will use "cam_dispersion_inc" value instead.
 This value is not capped in engine - negative values will cause negative recoil.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Another factor into dispersion (only affects iron sights/scopes).
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]If this parameter is not defined in the weapon section, the engine will use "cam_dispersion_frac" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The maximum angle that recoil can carry the crosshair from its origin - in this case, 50 degrees up (only affects iron sights/scopes).
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]If this parameter is not defined in the weapon section, the engine will use "cam_max_angle" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Maximum horizontal offset (only affects iron sights/scopes).
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]If this parameter is not defined in the weapon section, the engine will use "cam_max_angle_horz" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Horizontal recoil caused by firing. 0 will cause vertical recoil, negative will recoil to the left (only affects iron sights/scopes).
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[pda_blue]Notes:
 %c[ui_gray_2]If this parameter is not defined in the weapon section, the engine will use "cam_step_angle_horz" value instead.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Base "PDM". This effects accuracy similar to how fire_dispersion_base does. Lower values makes it more accurate. Also effects the handling stat of the weapon, alongside control_inertion_factor.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
 %c[d_cyan](!)%c[ui_gray_2] This is a statistic parameter.

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Multiplier that increases bullet spread based on the player's velocity.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Multiplier that increases bullet spread as the player accelerates.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Multiplier that effects spread while the player is crouched.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Multiplier that effects spread while the player is crouched, and not moving (basically at the player's most accurate).
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]How much condition effects dispersion - higher numbers result in more dramatic degradation.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]How quickly the AI's aim restores after a burst fire.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]The speed at which an AI restores aim after firing using iron sights/scopes.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]An AI's effective seeing range when carrying the weapon.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]An AI's field of view when carrying the weapon. 1.0 gives ~180 field of view.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Minimum radius in which you may be seen, in meters. Can cause interesting hijinks.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Maximum radius at which AI can distinguish friend or foe.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Whether or not to allow iron sights.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]How long it takes to aim down the sights.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]How much the FOV "zooms in" while aiming down the sights. 1 is default.
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]This number must equal the 'elapsed' variable - otherwise the value may not be either!
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range

%c[pda_green]Description:
 %c[ui_gray_2]Weapon Base Cost (bear in mind that this is affected by a lot of economic aspects)
 
 %c[pda_red]Range
 %c[ui_gray_2]$range
